channel.title: Massive (PI) help!
channel.description:
I'm currently useing Project Insanity, if you don't know leave now.
I have 5 stalls at home giving:
Choclate Cake Silk Ring Silver Dust Red Topaz
How can I change what you get from the stalls.
If you can help me that would mean so much to me!, i've been looking everywhere and I guess this is my last option.
Regards,
James

item.title: Massive (PI) help!
item.dc:creator: @i_lex_50_i i lex 50 i
item.description:
@i_lex_50_i wrote:

Hey, if you want to change what items you receive when stealing from the stalls, go here:

(This is in your server files)
Project Insanity\src\server\model\players

Then open “ActionHandler.java”

Finally, search for:

c.getThieving().stealFromStall

You should see all the 5 stalls (by default) listed, and you will be able to set what item to receive, how much exp you get and what level you need to thieve from the stall.

Example:

c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1897, 12, 1);

1897 is the itemID, 12 is exp amount (multiplied by 40 and 1.5 by default) and 1 is the level required to thieve.

Good luck and have fun!

Read full topic

item.title: Massive (PI) help!
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

it can’t find it, when I use zFilesearcher or whatever, but when I search getitems() this is what comes up in client

getItems().resetItems(3214);
getItems().sendWeapon(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], getItems().getItemName(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]));
getItems().resetBonus();
getItems().getBonus();
getItems().writeBonus();
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerHat],1,playerHat);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerCape],1,playerCape);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerAmulet],1,playerAmulet);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerArrows],playerEquipmentN[playerArrows],playerArrows);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerChest],1,playerChest);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerShield],1,playerShield);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerLegs],1,playerLegs);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerHands],1,playerHands);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerFeet],1,playerFeet);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerRing],1,playerRing);
getItems().setEquipment(playerEquipment[playerWeapon],playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon],playerWeapon);
getCombat().getPlayerAnimIndex(getItems().getItemName(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]).toLowerCase());
getPA().logIntoPM();
getItems().addSpecialBar(playerEquipment[p

item.title: Massive (PI) help!
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

It isn’t like that, if it was well, I wouldn’t be asking…

It’s:

if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) {
if (c.getItems().addItem(id,1)) {
c.startAnimation(832);
c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
c.sendMessage("You steal a " + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + “.”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Massive (PI) help!
item.dc:creator: @s_p_i_d_a_z s p i d a z
item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

well, james.
Find the ID of one of those items, Search for it till you see a whole bunch of thieving code.
or till you see an additem(id, 1);
That is probably it.

Read full topic
